item.title: Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii Is Down to Only $25 for Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
Ahoy, matey! We've found a great deal!

The legendary Black Friday sales are here, and hundreds of amazing video game deals are live across Amazon, Target, and Best Buy. Among these, the latest Yakuza game – Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii – is down to only $25. If you missed this one back in February, there has never been a better time to jump in and sail the seas with Goro Majima.

Score Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii for $25 During Black Friday

Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii - PlayStation 5

Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii might just be the most unique entry in the entire Like a Dragon/Yakuza series. Goro Majima wakes up on an island without his memories, and before long, he's the head of his very own crew of pirates. It's got the usual Yakuza beat 'em up gameplay, but Pirate Yakuza gets naval combat too, letting players command a pirate ship and attack others on the high seas.

If you've never played a Yakuza game, you can start with Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii if you wish. While the stories are all interconnected, each one stands on its own, too. Some events may not hit the same if you jump around, though, so we recommend playing in order, if possible.

While the next Yakuza game is a much-needed remake of Yakuza 3, Pirate Yakuza will still be a key piece of the story for the next mainline entry. As such, if you're aiming to catch up on the series anytime soon, this is a game you likely will need to play to be prepared for what's to come.

More Amazing Black Friday Video Game Deals

Noah Hunter is a freelance writer and reviewer with a passion for games and technology. He co-founded Final Weapon, an outlet focused on nonsense-free Japanese gaming (in 2019) and has contributed to various publishers writing about the medium.

item.title: Snag An Apple Watch At Walmart For As Low As $129
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

What time is it? It's time to check out these Black Friday deals on Apple Watches at Walmart. While multiple models are seeing discounts, one of the best budget-friendly options on sale right now is the Apple Watch SE second-generation line. You can buy a GPS-enabled 40mm version for $129 (was $279), a 44mm SE2 model for $159 (was $279), or grab the cellular version of both models for the same price.

Apple Watch SE 40mm (Second Generation)

$129

Not just useful for checking the time at the flick of a wrist, the Apple Watch SE2 is an affordable option for tracking your health and fitness. These are designed to seamlessly connect with your Apple devices, are water-resistant to 50 meters, and can be easily customized with a range of optional watch bands and watch faces sold separately. Anyone looking to track their activity can explore various metrics that the watch tracks, making this a solid option for first-time users.

Other features include Fall Detection, Crash Detection, and Emergency SOS. The watch also offers three months of Apple Fitness+ for free with the Workout app. This deal applies to all GPS and GPS + Cellular models in any available color while stock lasts.

Apple Watch SE 44mm (Second Generation)

$159

If your wrist is on the larger side, you'll want to grab the 44mm Apple Watch as these have wider bands. Like the 40mm version above, this deal applies to all GPS and GPS + Cellular models in any available color.

The Apple Watch SE2 earned positive reviews after it launch in 2022, with critics noting that it offered users a sharp Retina display, powerful processor, and versatile health-monitoring tools. Considering that these watches still command a high price tag--and newer models cost even more--we're not expecting Walmart's SE2 stock to last long.

Anyone looking for a fashion statement can also check out these deals on watches inspired by classic video games and consoles. The officially licensed Atari 2600, Space Invaders, and Tetris watches aren't just colorful tributes to video game history; they're interactive devices preloaded with video and arcade games that you can play on them.

item.title: Nintendo Expands Switch Online's NES And Game Boy Library With Four More Titles
item.content:encoded:
Battletoads, Kid Icarus and more!

If you've been wondering what's next for the Switch Online's 'Nintendo Classics' service, the November update is now available.

This latest update includes NES and Game Boy titles, with a total of four more games added to the service today. On the NES, there's Ninja Gaiden II: The Dark Sword of Chaos and Battletoads, and on the Game Boy, retro enthusiasts can look forward to Kid Icarus: Of Myths and Monsters and Bionic Commando.

Switch Online's Nintendo Classics service for Japan has received the same four titles in this week's update.

To access these titles, you'll need to have an active base-tier Switch Online subscription. This update for the Nintendo Classics library follows the arrival of the original Luigi's Mansion for the GameCube app in October.

What do you think of the latest additions to the Switch Online 'Nintendo Classics' library? Let us know in the comments.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

item.title: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond Launch Streams Announced, Watch "Top Streamers" Play
item.content:encoded:
Tune in next week

It's taken some time to get to this point, but Nintendo finally seems to be getting underway with its Metroid Prime 4: Beyond marketing campaign.

So far, we've got commercials and in-store demos, and now Nintendo's Canadian branch has announced it will be hosting a special event next week on 3rd December 2025, allowing fans to watch a "brave band" of "top streamers" explore planet Viewros as the renowned bounty hunter Samus Aran.

These will be two sponsored streams featuring @tetraninja and @JeuSerieux. Here's a rundown about both channels:

"Tetra Ninja is a YouTube content creator and full-time gamer who has been sharing his passion for video games with his community since 2010. Best known for his Let’s Play series, in which he guides viewers from the opening cutscene to the final boss, he offers an in-depth look at new releases as they launch. As a lifelong Nintendo fan, Tetra Ninja is excited to join Samus on an all-new mission in Metroid Prime 4: Beyond and can’t wait to bring his viewers along for the adventure."
Wednesday, December 3, 6:00 p.m. - 7:00 p.m. EST

"Le Jeu C'est Sérieux is a duo of video game enthusiasts made up of Guiz and Laurent. Nostalgia is a recurring theme for these partners in crime, specifically Guiz with his huge collection of NES™ games, while Laurent collects VHS recordings in search of artifacts of the video game past. They have shared their love of video games for over 10 years, both on YouTube and Twitch. As Metroid fans since the first NES game, they can't wait to be back on duty with renowned bounty hunter Samus Aran in Metroid Prime 4: Beyond."
Wednesday, December 3, 6:00 p.m. - 7:30 p.m. EST

This news follows Nintendo's recent rollout of demos at select in-store kiosks across North America. Nintendo has also revealed some other details ahead of the anticipated launch, such as the estimated file size of the game. You can find out more about all of this in our previous coverage:

Will you be checking out any video or stream footage before jumping into Metroid Prime 4: Beyond? How about the recent previews? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

[source nintendo.com]

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

item.title: Roborock Saros 10R Crashes $600 Off, 22,000 Pa Suction With Self-Emptying Station Hits All-Time Low
item.content:encoded:
Robot vacuums range from basic bump-and-go models that randomly wander your floors to sophisticated machines that map your home with surgical precision, and Roborock always positioned itself at the premium end with innovations that justify higher price tags. Each new model brings features that push the category forward, but that innovation typically costs serious money, with the flagship Saros 10R normally demanding $1,599 from your wallet.

The great news is that Amazon’s Black Friday deal slashes $600 off that price to bring it down to $999 (38% off) hitting an all-time low that makes this ultra-premium cleaner actually accessible instead of just aspirational. This discount transforms the most advanced robot vacuum on the market into something you can justify buying, and once it starts handling your cleaning routine, you’ll wonder how you ever tolerated doing floors manually.

See at Amazon

Engineering That Solves Real Cleaning Problems

The ultra-slim 3.14-inch profile lets this robot slip under furniture that standard vacuums can’t reach, thanks to the StarSight Autonomous System 2.0 that eliminates the raised LDS dome making most robot vacuums too tall for low-clearance spaces. You get cleaning coverage under beds, sofas, and cabinets where dust bunnies normally live undisturbed for months because your regular vacuum can’t fit.

3D sensing technology maps your home with precision, even in tight spaces under narrow-legged furniture, while the VertiBeam system navigates around cables without getting stuck or needing you to pre-clean your floors before the robot can do its job. Improved algorithms recognize and adapt to 108 different obstacle types, so it handles everything from pet toys to chair legs without calling for help every five minutes.

The 22,000 Pa HyperForce suction pulls dirt, pet hair, and debris from hardwood, tile, and carpets with enough power to handle embedded mess that weaker vacuums just push around. Combined, the Zero-Tangling DuoDivide main brush and anti-tangle omnidirectional wheels mean you never spend ten minutes cutting hair wraps off the roller bar-which, if you have long hair or pets, is basically the worst part of owning robot vacuums. The FlexiArm side brush and mop automatically extend to reach corners and edges that circular robots typically miss, sweeping along baseboards and into tight spots where crumbs accumulate.

The AdaptiLift chassis climbs over obstacles as high as 4 cm and tackles thresholds and furniture legs that stop lesser robots dead in their tracks and turn your open floor plan into an actual open floor plan rather than a series of isolated zones. The dual-spinning mops automatically lift when carpets get detected to avoid getting your rugs soaked while still making thorough mopping possible on hard floors.

The Multifunctional Dock 4.0 does the dirty work you would avoid by automatically washing mops in 176°F hot water and drying them with 131°F hot air to prevent mildew and smell. Auto dust collection works for 60 days before needing attention while auto tank refilling and detergent dispensing mean the robot maintains itself between the occasional check-in you give it.

At $999 instead of the usual $1,599, you’re saving $600 on a machine that brings flagship features reserved for people with unlimited home automation budgets. This Black Friday price opens up the most advanced robot vacuum technology to households wanting exceptional cleaning results without compromise on coverage, power, or convenience.

See at Amazon

item.title: Nintendo Adding Four Classic Games To Switch Online
item.content:encoded:
Four iconic NES and Game Boy games are coming to Nintendo Switch Online’s Classics catalog for November 2025. Two of them, in particular, are some deep-cut, difficult titles.

As a benefit of Nintendo Switch Online, the Classics catalog offers many nostalgic games from Nintendo’s past. There are plenty of titles to choose from, like Donkey Kong and Metroid 2: Return of Samus. While the Expansion Pack adds Nintendo 64 titles like Luigi’s Mansion, there’s still plenty of new additions to the base catalog. Now, there are some iconic games making their way to the Classics lineup that are sure to unlock some fun (and frustrating) memories.

Battletoads, Kid Icarus Coming to Nintendo Switch Online Tomorrow

In the video, shown above, we see four nostalgic games coming to the Nintendo Switch Online Classics Catalog for November 2025. Those games are Battletoads, Ninja Gaiden 2: The Dark Sword of Chaos, Bionic Commando, and Kid Icarus: Of Myths and Monsters. The titles will be available starting tomorrow, November 26th, for all Nintendo Switch Online players.

If you were an avid Nintendo fan in the 1990s, you know how difficult Ninja Gaiden 2 and Battletoads are. The iconic Turbo Tunnel level in Battletoads has left many with good and bad memories, depending on perspective. For Capcom lovers, Bionic Commando is a welcome sight, as the last time we saw the series was 2009’s controversial reboot. Then, Kid Icarus, who has yet to get another entry since 2012’s Uprising, can now complement the original, which Of Myth and Monsters is a sequel to.

What do you think of the new November 2025 Nintendo Switch Online lineup? Any games you remember from back in the day? Excited to try them out? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Nintendo, check out our articles on The Super Mario Galaxy Movie and Pokémon: Legends Z-A DLC. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

item.title: SHIFT UP’s Project Spirits to be published by Level Infinite globally
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Smartphone

The second global collaboration between Level Infinite and SHIFT UP.

Tencent subsidiary Level Infinite will publish Project Spirits, SHIFT UP‘s upcoming console, PC, and mobile cross-platform game developed on Unreal Engine 5, through a co-development collaboration between SHIFT UP and Tencent affiliate Yongxing Interactive, the companies announced.

Project Spirits marks the second global collaboration between Level Infinite and SHIFT UP following the success of GODDESS OF VICTORY: NIKKE, which Level Infinite publishes worldwide.

Get the details below.

Project Spirits is a cross-platform game for PC, consoles, and mobile developed on Unreal Engine 5, through a co-development collaboration between SHIFT UP and Tencent’s affiliate, Yongxing Interactive. Yongxing Interactive is dedicated to creating top-quality games. Its core team consists of senior members from leading game companies specializing in ACG (animation, comics, and games) games, bringing together solid industry experience and development capabilities.

This partnership represents the second global collaboration between Level Infinite and SHIFT UP, following the worldwide success of GODDESS OF VICTORY: NIKKE. Both companies are committed to achieving even greater synergy with Project Spirits than in their previous venture.

Leveraging SHIFT UP’s expertise and their proven success with globally acclaimed IPs such as GODDESS OF VICTORY: NIKKE and Stellar Blade, Level Infinite aims to deliver the next generation of gaming experiences to players worldwide. As part of this process, Level Infinite and SHIFT UP have further strengthened their strategic partnership to include both publishing and joint development.

item.title: Samsung T7 SSD Goes for Pocket Change Now, 2TB Drive Selling 68% Off Original Price
item.content:encoded:
Samsung earned its reputation as the most reliable brand for SSDs through years of consistent performance and the T7 has been an iconic model in portable storage since its launch a few years back. Traditional external hard drives (HDD) feel painfully slow once you experience the speed difference that solid-state technology delivers, and even more as this T7 model just hit a record low at $168 instead of the usual $187 (and $399 at launch!) for Black Friday on Amazon.

Most color options already sold out completely which leaves only the gray version in stock so you’ll need to move fast if you want one before inventory disappears entirely. This drive transfers files at speeds up to 1,050MB/s which means copying a full 4K movie takes under a minute instead of the 5+ minutes you’d spend waiting with an old spinning hard drive.

See at Amazon

Forget Your Old HDD

The USB 3.2 Gen 2 interface pushes read speeds to 1,050MB/s and write speeds close behind, which gives you transfer rates that actually match modern file sizes and project demands. You can edit 4K video directly from the drive without pre-copying footage to your computer’s internal storage, saving time and preserving precious laptop SSD space for applications and system files. With a total capacity of 2TB, you’ll have room for approximately 500,000 photos, 50 hours of 4K video, or your entire game library plus room for new titles.

Measuring smaller than a credit card and weighing only 58 grams, the compact design disappears into any bag pocket without adding noticeable bulk or weight to your carry. The metal construction provides shock resistance that protects your data against drops from as high as 2 meters-though you obviously shouldn’t test that limit on purpose, just because the specs say it can handle it.

Efficient thermal management keeps the drive cool during extended file transfers, preventing performance throttling when you’re moving massive amounts of data for longer periods. Password protection and AES 256-bit hardware encryption secure your files in case the drive gets lost or stolen, providing peace of mind that your client projects or personal photos will not end up in random hands.

Cross-platform compatibility works seamlessly across Windows, Mac, Android devices and gaming consoles without requiring reformatting or special drivers for basic use. The included USB-C to C and USB-C to A cables cover connection to virtually any modern device, though you’ll want the C-to-C cable for maximum speed with newer computers. Samsung’s Magician software provides drive health monitoring, firmware updates, and performance optimization tools that help maintain peak performance over the years. The three-year limited warranty backs up Samsung’s confidence in the drive’s reliability, covering manufacturing defects and giving you recourse if something goes wrong.

At $168 for 2TB of fast and reliable Samsung storage, you’re getting the brand’s proven track record at one of the lowest prices this model has ever seen which makes it the right moment to upgrade from slower storage solutions. This Black Friday deal delivers great portable storage at a price that finally makes sense for people who need speed and capacity without emptying their wallets.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/samsung-t7-ssd-goes-for-pocket-change-now-2tb-drive-selling-68-off-original-price-2000647374

item.title: Amazon Offloads 65W 3-Port Block Charger, 2-Pack Selling for 4x Cheaper Than One Apple Charger
item.content:encoded:
Buying official chargers from tech companies feels like highway robbery when you see Apple charging $59 for a basic 35W single-port USB-C adapter which makes you wonder if they think everyone has unlimited money to burn on accessories.

The Baseus 2-pack 65W charger bundle flips that equation completely by giving you two three-port chargers for $28 total, dropping from the usual $49 price tag to hit an all-time low for Black Friday on Amazon. Each charger pushes 65W when you plug in a single device which means you can actually fast-charge a MacBook Air at full speed instead of watching the battery percentage crawl upward like a lazy snail. You get six charging ports total across both units, and that’s the kind of flexibility that solves the eternal problem of fighting over outlets.

See at Amazon

65W, Two Chargers

The intelligent charging technology inside these blocks automatically figures out how much power each connected device needs and splits the 65W accordingly so you’re not manually calculating wattage or worrying about frying your phone because you plugged it into the wrong port. You can charge your laptop, phone, and earbuds simultaneously from a single charger without everything slowing down to a frustrating trickle, though connecting three devices does divide that 65W among them based on what each one can handle. It also operates on a 92% energy conversion rate thanks to the GaN chip technology which means less wasted electricity and noticeably cooler operation compared to older, silicon-based chargers that get hot enough to cook an egg.

The compact size is 41% smaller than Apple’s original 65W brick and matters more than you think once you’re trying to fit chargers into already-stuffed laptop bags or tight outlet spaces behind furniture. Foldable prongs collapse flush against the body so they won’t snag on clothes or scratch other gear rattling around in your backpack.

You can fast-charge an iPhone 17 from 0 to 50% in about 30 minutes or power up a Dell laptop without the need for its original, bulky charger. The USB-A port handles older devices that haven’t made the USB-C jump yet and saves you from having to carry separate adapters for wireless headphones, older tablets, or that one weird gadget that just refuses to adopt modern standards.

The lower operating temperature keeps these chargers safe to touch even after hours of continuous use, unlike some cheap alternatives that get concerningly hot and make you nervous about leaving them plugged in overnight. Each port delivers consistent power without the voltage fluctuations that can damage batteries over time, protecting your expensive devices while they charge.

At $28 for two 65W three-port chargers, you’re spending less than half what Apple charges for their wimpy 35W single-port adapter, and you’re getting roughly six times the functionality in return. This Black Friday price works out to $14 per charger which is basically impulse-purchase territory for accessories that’ll get daily use for years.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/amazon-offloads-65w-3-port-block-charger-2-pack-selling-for-4x-cheaper-than-one-apple-charger-2000647316

item.title: Sony Goes Zero-Profit on WH-1000XM5, 2x Cheaper Than AirPods Max and Bose
item.content:encoded:
Sony just launched the 1000XM6 headphones, pushing the XM5 model into second place in the lineup but the performance gap feels like a minimum while the price difference stretches over… $200! The new XM6 demands $449 while Amazon just dropped the WH-1000XM5 to $248 from its usual $399 (38% off), hitting a record low that makes this generation the obvious choice.

See at Amazon

This deal also positions the XM5 at roughly half the price of Apple’s AirPods Max which costs about $550 and delivers similar specs without justifying that massive premium. The feature sets across all these flagship models is nearly identical with slight tweaks that don’t justify paying double and makes this almost 40% Black Friday discount surprisingly aggressive for headphones that rank among the best available.

Noise Cancellation That Blocks the World

Adaptive noise cancelation technology automatically adjusts to your environment and head position with multiple microphones that sample ambient sound and produce opposing frequencies that cancel unwanted noise. You get great silence on planes, trains, and busy offices where background chatter normally destroys concentration and forces you to crank the volume to dangerous levels.

The Auto NC optimizer analyzes atmospheric pressure and adjusts cancellation accordingly which matters more than you might think when you’re flying at altitude, where changes in air density alter how sound travels. This system works so well that you’ll sometimes take the headphones off to check whether the announcements are playing or whether the cancellation merely served to block them out completely.

With noise canceling activated, battery life extends to 30 hours and covers weeks of daily commutes before needing a charge. Quick charging saves you when you forget to charge overnight and rush out the door: three hours of playback from just three minutes plugged in. The lightweight design distributes pressure evenly across your head, preventing the fatigue and headaches that plague cheaper headphones after an hour of wear. Soft ear cushions seal around your ears without creating that uncomfortable vacuum feeling, maintaining comfort during marathon listening sessions where lesser headphones become unbearable.

Sound quality delivers Sony’s signature balanced profile, with detailed mids, clear highs, and controlled bass that doesn’t overwhelm everything else into muddy soup. The 40mm drivers produce accurate audio reproduction across all frequencies, letting you hear instrument separation in complex mixes and subtle details in well-produced tracks.

Alexa voice control responds to commands without touching your phone, though Google Assistant and Siri also work if you prefer different ecosystems. The speak-to-chat feature automatically pauses music when you start talking, then resumes after you finish your conversation and removes the annoyance of manually controlling playback during brief interactions.

Multipoint connectivity lets you pair with two devices at once and fluidly switch from your laptop for work calls to your phone for music without needing to constantly disconnect and reconnect. Touch controls reside on the ear cups and manage volume, track skipping, and call management via swipes and taps, though the learning curve takes a few days before gestures become second nature. A carrying case with the headphones protects them during travel and folds flat to save bag space, while the headphones themselves fold into a compact shape rather than just having the ear cups swivel flat.

At $248 instead of $399, you’re saving $151 on headphones that match or outperform the competition at significantly higher price points including Apple’s AirPods Max at double this Black Friday price. That value gets even clearer when you put this deal up against the new XM6 at $449; for $201 extra, you’re getting marginal improvements that most won’t notice in real-world use.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/sony-goes-zero-profit-on-wh-1000xm5-2x-cheaper-than-airpods-max-and-bose-2000647400

item.title: Yakuza 0 Director’s Cut, Yakuza Kiwami, and Yakuza Kiwami 2 – PS5, Xbox Series, and PC digital upgrade offers announced
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Purchase each new release at a discount if you already own it digitally.

Publisher SEGA and developer Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio have announced discount offers for the upcoming PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC releases of Yakuza 0 Director’s Cut, Yakuza Kiwami, Yakuza Kiwami 2, which will be available to users who already own the digital versions of Yakuza 0, Yakuza Kiwami, and Yakuza Kiwami 2 on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, or PC.

Here are the details:

Yakuza 0 Director’s Cut

  • Features
    • Yakuza 0 Director’s Cut features newly added cutscenes, online cooperative “Red Light Raid” mode, English dub, and added text language support in French, Italian, German, Spanish, Latin American Spanish, Brazilian Portuguese, and Russian. The theme song “Bubble” that was not included in the original western release of Yakuza 0 has also been added.
  • Upgrade Offer
    • Those who have the digital version of Yakuza 0 for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, or Steam by December 8 at 08:29 a.m. PT / 11:59 a.m. ET may be able to upgrade to the digital version of Yakuza 0 Director’s Cut for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, or Steam for $14.99 (USD), a significant savings versus the $49.99 (USD) everyday price.
      • Discount only applicable for PlayStation 4 to PlayStation 5, Xbox One to Xbox Series X|S, and Steam to Steam versions of Yakuza 0 to Yakuza 0 Director’s Cut. Pricing and availability vary by region. Save data does not carry over between Yakuza 0 and Yakuza 0 Director’s Cut. This offer does not apply to subscription services (PlayStation Plus, Xbox Game Pass) or physical package versions of Yakuza 0.

Yakuza Kiwami

  • Features
    • Yakuza Kiwami features added text language support in French, Italian, German, Spanish, Latin American Spanish, Brazilian Portuguese, and Russian. The songs “Receive You [Reborn]” and “Bleed” that were not included in the original western release of Yakuza Kiwami have also been added.
  • Offer
    • Those who have the digital version of Yakuza Kiwami for PlayStation 4 or Xbox One by December 8 at 08:59 a.m. PT  / 11:59 a.m. ET may be able to upgrade to the digital version of Yakuza Kiwami for PlayStation 5 or Xbox Series for $1.99 (USD), a significant savings versus the $19.99 (USD) everyday price.
      • A Steam version of Yakuza Kiwami with the added text language support will also be released on December 8 at 09:00 a.m. PT / 12:00 p.m. ET. Details for those who get Yakuza Kiwami prior to December 8 at 09:00 a.m. PT / 12:00 p.m. ET will be shared after the new version’s release.
      • Discount only applicable for PlayStation 4 to PlayStation 5 and Xbox One to Xbox Series versions of Yakuza Kiwami. Pricing and availability vary by region. Save data does not carry over to new versions. This offer does not apply to subscription services (PlayStation Plus, Xbox Game Pass) or physical package versions of Yakuza Kiwami.

Yakuza Kiwami 2

  • Features
    • Yakuza Kiwami 2 features added text language support in French, Italian, German, Spanish, Latin American Spanish, Brazilian Portuguese, and Russian.
  • Offer
    • Those who have the digital version of Yakuza Kiwami 2 for PlayStation 4 or Xbox One by December 8th 09:00 am PST may be able to upgrade to the digital version of Yakuza Kiwami 2 for PlayStation 5 or Xbox Series X|S at no cost.
      • A Steam version of Yakuza Kiwami 2 with the added text language support will also be released on December 8 at 09:00 a.m. PT / 12:00 p.m. ET. Details for those who get Yakuza Kiwami 2 prior to December 8 at 09:00 a.m. PT / 12:00 p.m. ET will be shared after the new version’s release.
      • Discount only applicable for PlayStation 4 to PlayStation 5 and Xbox One to Xbox Series versions of Yakuza Kiwami 2. Pricing and availability vary by region. Save data does not carry over to new versions. This offer does not apply to subscription services (PlayStation Plus, Xbox Game Pass) or physical package versions of Yakuza Kiwami 2.

The new releases of Yakuza 0 Director’s Cut, Yakuza Kiwami, and Yakuza Kiwami 2 are due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC on December 8.

item.title: Apple AirTag 4-Pack Goes for Pennies Now, Samsung and Tile Made Copies but Nobody Beats the Real Thing
item.content:encoded:
Apple refuses to discount products on its own website even for items that have been around for years like the AirTag which means you need to shop smarter and hit up retailers with actual pricing flexibility like Amazon. These Bluetooth trackers just dropped to $64 for a four-pack from the usual $99, which marks an all-time low with the kind of discount you rarely see on Apple products.

AirTags solve the daily frustration of searching for misplaced items by letting you ping their location through your iPhone’s Find My network and turns frantic morning searches into quick 30-second retrievals.

See at Amazon

Precision Finding That Actually Works in Real Life

The Find My network uses hundreds of millions of Apple devices to detect the location of your AirTag anonymously and relay that information, creating a crowdsourced tracking system that works even when your tagged item ends up miles away from you. You get precision finding with iPhone models that feature the U1 chip, which uses ultra-wideband technology to guide you directly to your lost item with on-screen arrows and distance measurements.

Setup takes literally one tap when you hold an AirTag near your iPhone or iPad, with the device automatically recognizing it and walking you through naming and assigning it to an item. The CR2032 battery lasts over a year before needing replacement, and swapping it out requires just a quick twist of the AirTag’s back cover rather than sending the whole unit back to Apple or dealing with proprietary charging cables.

There’s also a built-in speaker for playing sounds to help find items when they’re nearby but buried in couch cushions or hiding in your coat pocket. Its volume could be louder to find tags in noisy environments. Water and dust resistance, thanks to its IP67 rating, means your AirTag survives being caught in rain, dropped in puddles, or living inside your gym bag with sweaty clothes.

Privacy protections prevent creepy tracking scenarios by alerting you if an unknown AirTag follows you around, addressing concerns of people using these devices to stalk others without consent. The system regularly rotates Bluetooth identifiers so that random people can’t track your movements by detecting the same AirTag signal repeatedly over time. If you find a lost AirTag, you can tap it with any NFC-capable phone to see the owner’s contact information if they’ve marked it as lost, making returns possible even for non-iPhone users.

The four-pack setup gives you enough AirTags to cover your most frequently misplaced items, such as keys, wallet, backpack, and luggage, without needing to constantly move a single tracker between items. You can label each AirTag with custom names and emojis in the Find My app, making it easy to tell “work backpack” from “gym bag” at a glance. The system works seamlessly across your Apple devices, so you can trigger an AirTag sound from your iPad when your iPhone is the thing you actually lost.

At $64 for four AirTags, instead of the usual $99, you pay $16 per tracker instead of nearly $25 and that finally brings the cost per unit down to something reasonable rather than feeling like the Apple tax in full effect. This Black Friday discount makes equipping your entire life with tracking capabilities actually affordable, especially compared to buying AirTags individually at a price of $29 each when you need more than one or two.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/apple-airtag-4-pack-goes-for-pennies-now-samsung-and-tile-made-copies-but-nobody-beats-the-real-thing-2000647334

item.title: The Best PC And PS5 SSD Black Friday Deals
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Solid-state drives (SSDs) have come a long way over the years, evolving from expensive storage devices into affordable upgrades for PCs and consoles. For Black Friday, SSDs from various manufacturers are on sale, with a wide range of capacities available. Considering that modern-day video games require more storage space than ever before, a storage capacity is an essential purchase for PC and console players--and grabbing one while they're on sale is a great opportunity to add a terabyte or four to your devices at more affordable price points. To help you find the best deals, we've rounded up a selection of discounted SSDs in the lists below. You'll find models that work on PC and PS5, as well as proprietary storage card expansions for Xbox Series X, and MicroSD cards for Switch, Switch 2, and Steam Deck. We've also thrown in a few SSD heatsinks and external drive options as well. Note that these are all limited-time deals, so pricing and availability may change.

Once you've browsed all the SSD drives below, check out GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub for the latest discounts on hardware, video games, Blu-rays, and more.

2TB SSDs

$135 - $190

While an extra terabyte is great for your system, a 2TB SSD is even better. These don't cost much more than the 1TB SSDs, and you can get one like the Crucial P310 2280 for as low as $135. This has read/write speeds of up to 6,000 MB/s and 7,100 MB/s, making it ideal for PS5 consoles. The more expensive options here include the officially licensed Seagate PS5 SSD for $170 (was $215) and the Crucial T710 for $190 (was $320). The Crucial SSD is once again specced beyond what is required for a PS5 console, so PC power users looking to handle demanding programs and move large files will want to consider grabbing this one.

  • Crucial P310 2280 -- $135 ($178)
  • Seagate 2TB Game Drive For PS5 -- $170 ($215)
  • Crucial T710 -- $190 ($320)

4TB SSDs

$240 (was $328)

A 4TB SSD is pretty big, but the benefit of installing one is that you'll future-proof your PC or PS5. One of the best deals we've seen so far for these chunky SSDs is the PS5-compatible Crucial P310, which will work just fine in a PC as well. It delivers up to 7,100 MB/s read and 6,000 MB/s write speeds, and it's on sale for $240 (was $328).

SSD Heatsinks

As mentioned above, some of these SSDs will require a heatsink. PS5 owners can get the Sabrent heatsink for just $10 (was $14), and it's designed to seamlessly fit an M.2 drive and replace the native PS5 cover when placed in the expansion bay. Constructed from high-quality CNC'd aluminum, this has been a popular choice because it efficiently disperses heat.

If you're in the market for a regular heatsink for your PC SSD, you can get a double-sided cooler for $7. The other option is to turn your SSD into an external storage device using the UGreen SSD enclosure. Priced at $16 (was $23), this will enable an SSD to reach a data transfer rate of 10 Gbps.

  • Sabrent Heatsink -- $10 ($14)
  • NVMe M.2 SSD Heatsink -- $7
  • UGreen SSD enclosure -- $16 ($23)

For Xbox console users

Currently, options for Xbox Series X|S owners are more limited for Black Friday, with the big deal being the 4TB Seagate Extreme expansion card. This will massively increase the storage capacity you can access on your Xbox console, and the expansion card is compatible with Xbox's Velocity architecture. This means you'll get lightning-fast load times in your games, and if you have multiple consoles, you can easily transfer data with this little drive. Xbox consoles have a dedicated expansion card port, making it an easy plug-and-play solution for adding more storage. These are also available in 1TB and 2TB versions.

  • Xbox 1TB Expansion Card -- $130 ($160)
  • Xbox 2TB Expansion Card -- $200 ($260)
  • Xbox 4TB Expansion Card -- $380 ($500)

MicroSD Card Deals

While the above SSDs deals will add storage space to your PC, PS5, or Xbox Series X, those who play on dedicated handhelds like the Switch, Switch 2, or Steam Deck can also increase their device's capacity thanks to the many microSD card deals available during Black Friday as well. While there are several great options to choose from, note that certain devices require specific microSD models, so we've broken the list below into separate categories depending on if you're looking to upgrade a Switch 2, original Switch, or Steam Deck.

MicroSD cards for Switch 2

Switch 2 owners looking to improve on the handheld's modest 256GB internal storage capacity will need to pick one of the ultra-fast microSD Express cards listed below. MicroSD Express cards are much faster than other SD card models, but they're also more expensive per GB, so expect to pay more for smaller capacities than with older SD cards. Nevertheless, it's still worth the upgrade. Upcoming Switch 2 games are also quite big, with titles like Metroid Prime 4: Beyond, Kirby Air Riders, and Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment ranging from 21 to over 40GB in size. Third-party games are also quite large--and most are only available as digital or Game Key-Card releases, both of which require you to download and install the game to your Switch 2's internal drive, which makes the microSD Express cards all the more useful, despite their higher cost. Here's a look at Switch 2-compatible microSD Express cards that are available now:

  • Samsung Switch 2 256GB microSD Express -- $59
  • Samsung P9 512GB microSD Express -- $75 ($100)
  • Samsung P9 256GB microSD Express -- $47.49 ($55)
  • Lexar Play Pro 256GB microSD Express -- $49.49 ($60)
  • Lexar Play Pro 512GB microSD Express -- $99.49 ($120)
  • Lexar Play Pro 1TB microSD Express -- $199.49 ($220)
  • Adata 256GB Premier Extreme microSD Express -- $60 ($70)
  • Adata 512GB Premier Extreme microSD Express -- $100 ($130)
  • Addlink 256GB microSD Express -- $59.44
  • Addlink 512GB microSD Express -- $96.44 ($110)
  • PNY 128GB microSD Express -- $46
  • PNY 256GB microSD Express -- $53 ($60)
  • PNY 512GB microSD Express -- $120
  • Silicon Power 1TB microSD Express -- $195.49 ($230)
  • SanDisk 512GB microSD Express -- $120
  • SanDisk 256GB microSD Express -- $60 ($70)
  • SanDisk 128GB microSD Express -- $69.44
  • TeamGroup Apex 128GB microSD Express -- $36 ($39)
  • TeamGroup Apex 256GB microSD Express -- $47.49 ($60)
  • TeamGroup Apex 512GB microSD Express -- $97 ($120)
  • TeamGroup Apex 1TB microSD Express -- $199.49 ($212)

For Steam Deck and Switch 1 players

Steam Deck and Switch 1 owners can also score a great deal on storage upgrades--and since these devices are compatible with older (and slower) microSD cards, you can save a bit more and come away with even more extra install space than what you'd pay for a microSD Express card. Just keep in mind these do not work with the Switch 2.

  • Samsung EVO Select 512GB microSD card -- $33 ($47)
  • Samsung 1TB Pro Plus 1TB microSD card -- $80 ($120)
  • Samsung Evo Select 1TB microSD card -- $80 ($93)
  • Sandisk Extreme 1TB microSD card -- $96.75 ($131.49)

General storage deals

Finally, general storage drives are also on sale for Black Friday. These options are more limited, but they are still good-looking devices that you can use to keep your downloaded PS5 games in one place before transferring them to the main console SSD. You can also run PS4 games from them on your PS5. Portable SSDs like the Crucial X10 are the best thanks to their high read/write speeds, but portable hard-disk drives like the ones from Seagate and Lexar still do a great job of storing the raw data of your files so that you don't have to sit through a lengthy download.

  • Seagate 5TB Game Drive for PS5 -- $130 ($150)
  • Seagate 2TB Game Drive for Xbox -- $80 ($90)
  • Lexar 2TB External SSD -- $109.49 ($160)
  • Seagate 4TB External HDD -- $100 ($125)
  • Western Digital 5TB External HDD -- $125 ($155)
  • Crucial X10 2TB Portable SSD -- $135 ($212)

item.title: Gamegenic TCG Accessory Showcase - Gifts For Every Gamer
item.content:encoded:
Some of the hardest gamers to get gifts for these days are the dedicated TCG players in your life. Do they like this set of cards or think it was a dud? Do they have everything they need from the newest release? These are the questions the wrack many a gift giver’s mind! That’s why I thought it would be useful to check out a whole suite of new product releases from Gamegenic, my fave TCG accessory maker, to see what’s new and worth your consideration.

Epically Huge Game Boxes

I first fell in love with Gamegenic with their smaller-sized deck boxes. Expertly crafted, they're perfect for storing a Commander Deck, your favorite rares, and more. But it wasn't until checking out this latest batch of new releases that I've finally seen the light on their larger (heck, downright huge) game boxes.

Collectors' Lair 2000+

Just look at the size of this massive beast! Able to hold over 2000 cards (hence the 2000+ in the name), the Collectors' Lair is now my go-to for storing multiple decks safely and securely. The picture above shows it next to the Gamegenic Watchtower 100+ Convertible for scale. If you're not familiar with the Watchtower... it's not tiny!

My friend and I are foolish enough to have embarked on the 36 deck challenge, where we challenge ourselves to build 32 different Magic: The Gathering Commander decks (one for each of the different possible color combos, plus mono-colored decks and colorless), and I desperately needed a storage solution.

I'm nowhere near completing the goal, but the Collectors' Lair is exactly what I need to store my growing collection of decks. Just check out the pic below to see how I put it to work!

Whether storing full-on deckboxes in here, or just a loose assembly of cards, everything in this deck box is ready, safely stored, and good to go. But what if I want a (somewhat) more portable option?

Dungeon Pro Convertible

The Gamegenic Dungeon Pro Convertible has quickly become my new go-to for all my on-the-go gaming needs. Now, obviously, this isn't the kind of box I bring to a game night where we're only hoping to grind out a few games, but when I know I've got a full day of gaming ahead of me -- this is the box I load up and take with me.

Included with this box, and this is really my favorite part, is a very handy bag - which instantly turns my collection into a mobile backpack full of janky decks!

The "Convertible" aspect of this deck box comes from the inclusion of a removable acrylic divider, which I keep in here to make sure my deck boxes stay orderly. Truly one of my favorite new ways to cart like... I dunno, half my collection around!

Sidekick Pro 100+ XL Convertible in Teal/Pink

Now THIS is a "Giaco-coded" deck box - I love the lean here into these neon, bright, vibrant, and totally 1990s colors. For a retro geek like me, there's nothing better! 

Moving away from the gargantuan releases, this deck box comfortably holds a sleeved up deck of 100 cards. As you can see from the photo above, there are a few fun bells and whistles here, too. First off, there's the acrylic slide for you to put your commander (if you're playing Commander), or another feature card in your deck/collection.

Along with that, and a feature in a lot of their deck boxes, is the little tray at the bottom designed to hold other little treasures. I keep my dice in these to make sure I'm never fumbling through my bag looking for a few d6's.

Gamegenic Stranger Things Hellfire Club Official Accessories

While it's hard to see anything Hellfire Club branded and not shed a tear for our favorite shredder (if you know, you know), it's hard to deny just how rad these new Gamegenic Stranger Things officially licensed accessories look. In an exciting turn for Gamegenic, they're moving further into the Tabletop RPG space with these new releases.

Of all the products in this line -- which includes a playmat, metal dice (not pictured above), a dice tower, dice bag, sleeves, and more -- I think my favorite of the batch are the set of d6's. The 6 on these dice are represented by the Hellfire Club logo, and the dice themselves have a great feel, rounded edges, and I love the creepy swirl of red and blue.

Gamegenic Official Magic: The Gathering Accessories

Finally, let's take a look at some recent official collabs with Magic: The Gathering, including some of my favorite new releases.

Spider-Man Shiny Playmats

I think some of my favorite artwork from the recent Magic: The Gathering set comes from this cycle of full-art basic lands, where Spider-Man's webbing traces out the mana symbol. Gamegenic made five of these - one for each color - and they've got a nice, high-quality design and a gorgeous, subtle shine to them.

Spider-Man Soft Crate 80+

The new Spider-Man set also gave us some incredible artwork of Spider-Man and Spider-Gwen swinging into action, which they've translated nicely into this new Soft Crate 80+ deckbox. The deckbox "officially" holds 80 double-sleeved cards, but if you don't double-sleeve your deck you can - in my opinion - absolutely fit a whole commander deck in here.

That just about wraps up our rundown of some of my favorite new releases from Gamegenic. Whether you're looking for a little gifting inspiration, or you're just searching for a new, great storage solution, I really don't think there's much better on the market than Gamegenic.

The Gamegenic products used in this roundup were provided by Asmodee USA and pulled from the author's personal collection.

Giaco Furino joined the TechRaptor team as a Staff Writer in 2019 after searching for a dedicated place to write and talk about Tabletop Games. In 2020, he… More about Giaco



https://techraptor.net/tabletop/features/gamegenic-tcg-accessory-guide-gifts-for-every-gamer

item.title: DJI Lost Its Mind on Mic Mini, Premium Wireless Transmitter Crashes to All-Time Low on Amazon
item.content:encoded:
It wasn’t long before wireless microphones became essential equipment for content creators tired of dealing with tangled cables and audio that sounds like you’re recording in a bathroom. The DJI Mic Mini earned its spot as the go-to choice among top creators for good reason, and the bundle with two transmitters is now entirely out of stock on Amazon, which says it all about how hot this system is.

But the good news, another DJI bundle with a single transmitter has fallen to $45 from its usual $89 price tag (49% off), hitting an all-time low that makes professional audio accessible without the usual sticker shock. This deal probably won’t last that long considering just how fast the dual pack disappeared and getting one now beats waiting for empty stock pages later.

See at Amazon

Audio Quality That Separates Amateur From Pro

The DJI Mic Mini captures detail-rich audio with noise-canceling technology that removes background hum, wind noise, and the general chaos of recording in real-world environments instead of soundproof studios. You get automatic limiting that prevents distortion when your voice gets loud or excited, saving you from that clipping audio that ruins otherwise perfect takes.

The ultralight design weighs so little you forget you’re wearing it after the first few minutes, and that matters during long recording sessions when heavier mics start to feel like ankle weights around your collar. The 400-meter transmission range gives you freedom to move without staying tethered to your camera or phone, whether filming a house tour, doing street interviews, or just walking and talking through your latest vlog idea.

It works seamlessly with an iPhone, Android, or camera via plug-and-play connectivity that doesn’t take an engineering degree to set up. You clip the transmitter onto your shirt, plug the receiver into your device, and in mere seconds, you are recording clean audio instead of wrestling for twenty minutes trying to get a connection.

This compact receiver easily slides onto your camera’s hot shoe or directly connects to your phone, not adding bulk that makes your entire setup feel awkward and unbalanced. The battery life will easily last long enough for several shoots before needing to be recharged: you won’t have to constantly interrupt your creative flow, looking for a place to swap batteries or find power outlets.

Recording quality jumps noticeably compared to the built-in microphones on phones and cameras, and gives your videos that polished sound which actually makes viewers want to stick around rather than click away after ten seconds. The system automatically syncs audio to your video feed, and saves you the frustration of manually matching sound files in editing software later. Wind noise reduction works impressively well for outdoor recording, though extremely windy days still benefit from the included windscreen that blocks gusts without muffling your voice.

At $45 for this one-transmitter setup, you’re paying half the normal price for audio gear that immediately elevates your content above the tinny, echo-filled sound that screams “amateur hour” to anyone watching. Professional wireless systems from traditional audio brands cost three or four times this price, and they don’t necessarily sound better or work more reliably than the Mic Mini delivers.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/dji-lost-its-mind-on-mic-mini-premium-wireless-transmitter-crashes-to-all-time-low-on-amazon-2000647310

item.title: Seagate 22TB Hard Drive Cut 55% Off, Giant Storage Cheaper Than Tiny 4TB Budget Drives
item.content:encoded:
SSDs are fast but their high cost-per-gigabyte makes them impractical for storing large quantities of data. For simple bulk storage where capacity is more important than ultra-fast transfer speeds, traditional HDDs still rule and Seagate just hit record low pricing across its lineup during Black Friday Week.

However most capacities sold out rapidly, with only the massive 22TB model still in stock at $229 instead of the usual $249, and way down from its $599 launch price that made early adopters wince. That works out to about one cent per gigabyte and it’s the best value cost-per-GB storage you can find right now on Amazon during Black Friday.

See at Amazon

Handles Your Entire Digital Life

The 22TB capacity gives you breathing room that smaller drives simply can’t match, letting you dump entire external drive collections onto a single unit instead of managing multiple devices with confusing labels. You can store roughly 4,400 hours of HD video, 5.5 million photos, or 440,000 music files which covers most people’s entire digital collection with space left over for years of future growth.

USB 3.0 connectivity delivers transfer speeds around 120-160MB/s depending on file types which means copying a 100GB folder takes about 10-15 minutes instead of the sub-minute transfers you’d get with an SSD. That speed difference matters less for archival storage where you’re moving files once and accessing them occasionally rather than working directly from the drive daily.

Plug-and-play design works straight out of the box with Windows and Mac computers, with no software installation or superfluous setup processes to waste your time. You just connect the USB cable, wait for your computer to recognize the drive, and start dragging files over like you would with any storage device. Included Rescue Data Recovery Services provide a safety net if the drive fails and offers professional data recovery attempts that normally cost hundreds or thousands of dollars separately.

The drive runs quietly during operation without the loud clicking and whirring that older external drives produced, though you’ll still hear some mechanical noise since spinning platters can’t match the silent operation of solid-state drives. Seagate’s build quality has improved over the years, with these expansion drives showing solid reliability ratings from users who’ve run them continuously for backup operations. The vertical orientation saves desk space compared to laying drives flat, and the simple black design blends into any workspace without drawing attention.

At $229 for 22TB of storage, you’re paying roughly a penny per gigabyte which is absolutely the floor for cost-effective bulk storage right now in this Black Friday window. The $20 discount from the recent $249 price adds up when you’re buying this much capacity, and compared to the insane $599 launch price, this deal feels like robbery in your favor.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/seagate-22tb-hard-drive-cut-55-off-giant-storage-cheaper-than-tiny-4tb-budget-drives-2000647391

item.title: LEGO Offloads R2-D2 Set at All-Time Low, Amazon Goes Zero-Profit to Move Final Star Wars Stock
item.content:encoded:
Black Friday typically means massive LEGO discounts on Amazon with fans waiting to finally pick up those sets they have been eyeing all year at reasonable prices. This year feels a bit like a disappointment as the number of discounted sets fell significantly compared to previous years.

One of the most iconic Star Wars sets managed to make it through with a proper deal, though: the R2-D2 building set dropped to $79 from its usual $99 price tag, and reaches an all-time low that makes this the perfect time to grab it. Star Wars is LEGO’s most popular licensed theme and R2-D2 stands as one of the franchise’s most beloved characters, so getting this particular set on sale feels like winning the Black Friday lottery.

See at Amazon

Building Experience That Balances Display and Play

The 1,050-piece construction gives you a satisfying build session that takes several hours without becoming frustratingly complex, hitting that sweet spot where you’re engaged but not pulling your hair out over confusing instructions. You assemble R2-D2’s iconic dome head with 360-degree rotation capability, letting you position him looking in any direction once he’s on display. The detachable third leg recreates the droid’s mobility configuration from the films, adding an authentic detail that fans immediately recognize and appreciate. Attachable tools and a periscope give you multiple display options, so you can swap accessories based on your mood or recreate specific scenes from the movies.

The finished model stands over 9 inches tall, 6 inches wide, and 4 inches deep, and makes it substantial enough to command attention on a shelf without dominating an entire room like some of Lego’s massive Ultimate Collector Series sets. Once completed, build quality feels solid, with sturdy connections that let you pick up and reposition the model without pieces falling off every time you touch it. Color accuracy is perfect and matches R2-D2’s blue and white scheme with just the right shades that make the droid instantly recognizable even from across a room.

The included 25th-anniversary Darth Malak minifigure adds collectible value beyond just the main R2-D2 build by giving you a character from the expanded Star Wars universe that doesn’t appear in many sets. The information plaque and display stand, decorated with the LEGO Star Wars 25th Anniversary logo, turn this from just a toy into a proper display piece that looks intentional on your desk or bookshelf.

It works equally well for kids aged 10 and upwards who want to play out Star Wars scenarios and adult collectors who just want a detailed replica sitting next to their other memorabilia. The articulation points and removable accessories encourage actual play rather than static display, but the model is sturdy enough to survive either use case without falling apart.

At $79 instead of the usual $99, you’re saving $20 on one of the few discounted Star Wars LEGO sets available this Black Friday which makes this deal worth jumping on before stock runs out or the price creeps back up.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/lego-offloads-r2-d2-set-at-all-time-low-amazon-goes-zero-profit-to-move-final-star-wars-stock-2000647327

item.title: Ubisoft, Face Covered In Bruises, Once Again Confidently Extends Foot Towards End Of Rake
item.content:encoded:
'The team is aware of the criticisms around AI in games'

Published: November 25, 2025, 5:43 pm

Earlier this week Ubisoft announced Teammates, which the company describes as its first "playable generative AI research project which explores how AI can be used to deepen the player experience through real-time voice commands and enhanced gameplay".

Upon reading that, my first reaction was "well that's some bullshit", but quickly following was a second reaction that I remember hearing something similar before. From Ubisoft. Promises of a bold new future, of pioneering new technology that would empower players to own their own stories, but which ultimately led nowhere, because they were so patently and obviously stupid.

Over the last four years, the company--which has been in serious financial and legal trouble for a very long time--sure has been excited to hitch its cart (and its workers, resources and reputation) to whatever picture of a horse the latest Silicon Valley huckster has forwarded into CEO Yves Guillemot's inbox that week.

Like how in 2021 the company first announced Ubisoft Quartz, "an NFT initiative which allows people to buy artificially scarce digital items using cryptocurrency". Ghost Recon Breakpoint, the first game to make use of that marketplace, was cancelled less than a year later.

Or in February 2022, when Ubisoft announced its first foray into the metaverse, with a Rabbids world for the Sandbox platform, designed "to empower players to create their own original experiences incorporating elements of our gaming IP". Earlier this year Sandbox laid off half its staff, amid claims the "platform...now attracts only a few hundred daily users, largely bots".

Then in October 2024 Ubisoft released Champions Tactics: Grimoria Chronicles, a PvP tactical RPG with a "crypto-backed marketplace". At time of launch the most expensive collectible for the game was "worth" over $60,000. Just a year later the game's shopfront looks like this:

Now, in November 2025 comes Teammates, a project building on some ghastly stuff they first teased last year, and which is so on-the-nose that Ubisoft had to put a disclaimer in its own press release:

The team is aware of the criticisms around AI in games. The goal is not to replace creatives, but rather to find ways to enhance it by combining the strengths of the technology and the human creativity and ingenuity that are crucial to making games.

This is a company run by the dumbest people on the planet. I look forward to updating this post in two years' time to make fun of whatever new set of keys someone is jingling in front of Ubisoft's face. If they're still around to fall for it.



https://aftermath.site/ubisoft-ai-teammates-im-so-tired/

item.title: SanDisk Makes Zero-Profit Play on 2TB SSD, Flagship Storage Drops to Pennies on Amazon
item.content:encoded:
Backing up files or moving large projects between devices should not feel like paint drying but traditional hard drives (HDD) make you wait what felt like forever as they spin and click their way through transfers. External SSDs changed the game when they reduced those wait times to mere seconds instead of minutes and the SanDisk 2TB SSD takes the speed advantage and wraps it in a package that is tough enough to survive your daily chaos.

This drive hits read speeds up to 1050MB/s and write speeds around 1000MB/s which means transferring a 4K movie takes about 30 seconds instead of several minutes. Its 2TB capacity gives you plenty of room for your entire photo library and a solid collection of games. And the good news, Amazon dropped the price to $179 from the usual $209 for Black Friday (and it was launched at $250) which marks an all-time low.

See at Amazon

Speed That Matches Your Workflow

The NVMe solid-state performance inside this compact drive delivers the kind of transfer rates that make backing up your laptop or editing 4K footage directly from the drive practical. You can drag and drop a 50GB project folder and watch it complete before you finish your coffee which beats the old-school external hard drive experience where you’d start a transfer and go make lunch.

The USB-C connection works with both USB 3.2 Gen 2 and backward-compatible ports so you’re not locked into only the newest devices. This level of performance allows video editors to work with high-resolution footage without needing to pre-copy everything to their internal drive first and allows photographers to cull through thousands of RAW files without the lag that makes you want to throw your mouse across the room.

The IP65 rating protects against water splashes and dust intrusion which matters more than you think when you’re tossing this drive in bags, leaving it on outdoor shoot locations, or just living your normal clumsy life. SanDisk upgraded the drop protection to 3 meters, so those accidental falls from your desk or even that low tree branch on a hiking shoot aren’t going to turn your entire project archive into a paperweight.

The rubberized exterior provides grip and another layer of shock absorption while the included carabiner loop lets you clip it to your backpack or belt loop if you’re the type that needs gear within arm’s reach at all times. That 256-bit AES hardware encryption with password protection keeps your files secure in case the drive goes missing, giving you one less thing to panic about if you leave it in a coffee shop.

The SanDisk Memory Zone app will help you figure out what’s taking up space and automatically back up your phone content so you don’t have to remember to do this every few months. Because of solid-state technology (not generating the heat from spinning platters), the drive keeps cool during long transfer sessions, and a compact form factor means it disappears into any bag pocket.

For $179, 2TB of fast, rugged storage costs less than 9 cents per gigabyte, and that’s exactly the kind of value that makes upgrading your entire backup strategy a no-brainer instead of a budget debate.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/sandisk-makes-zero-profit-play-on-2tb-ssd-flagship-storage-drops-to-pennies-on-amazon-2000647292

item.title: Netflix’s Assassin’s Creed Series Casts Euphoria Actor as Lead
item.content:encoded:
The upcoming Netflix live-action adaptation of Assassin’s Creed has cast a co-lead for the show. Furthermore, it’s an actor whose resume includes projects like Euphoria and The Bikeriders.

The Assassin’s Creed series of games has been going strong since 2007. Spanning eras of history with action-packed gameplay and gripping story, it’s had a decent streak recently. A film adaptation starring X-Men: First Class’ Michael Fassbender came out in 2016 to negative press. However, revealed earlier this year, Netflix is working with Ubisoft to develop a live-action Assassin’s Creed series. Multiple ones are in the works, as revealed in the blog from July, but it seems traction has been gained on at least one of them.

Toby Wallace to Co-Lead Netflix’s Assassin’s Creed Series

In an exclusive report from Deadline, actor Toby Wallace is set to co-lead Netflix’s Assassin’s Creed series. While no date or story was announced, it’s stated that he will be a series regular. Even more so, the report says that filming will occur in Italy, which may serve as the main setting.

Toby Wallace is a fairly new actor, only having a few big roles under his belt, like The Bikeriders and Eden. However, the actor is set to star as a series regular in the new season of HBO’s Euphoria. An interesting tidbit is that Wallace will co-lead, so another actor, not yet known, will star alongside him. Given the game’s usage of present and past, perhaps another actor will play the ancestor or present-day descendant. In the film, Michael Fassbender played both parts, so maybe the co-lead is a Templar head or another role. Either way, it’ll be interesting to see how the cast, and show, shape up.

What do you think of Toby Wallace’s casting in Netflix’s Assassin’s Creed series? Do you think the show will work out? Who do you want to see cast in the series? Any actor in particular? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Assassin’s Creed, check out our exclusive articles on Black Flag Remake’s release and the cancelled Civil War game. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

Level Up Your Gaming News

Real-time news, exclusive podcasts, push alerts, and a better reading experience.

Available on Android
